00011   PhaseHistory::PhaseHistory(Phase* p,int* ct,int max_h) 
00012     : phase(p), current_time(ct), max_history(max_h), active(false), last_activation_time(-1), 
00013       last_deactivation_time(-1) {
00014     history.push_back(-1);
00015   }

00021   void PhaseHistory::setInitialState(){
00022     if(isActive())
00023       deactivate(*current_time);
00024   }

00036   bool PhaseHistory::isActive(){
00037     return wasActive(*current_time);
00038   }

00040   bool PhaseHistory::wasActive(int time){
00041     int size = history.size();
00042     for(int i=1;i < size-1; i+=2){
00043       // If active in the interval..
00044       if(time >= history[i] && time < history[i+1]){
00045         return true;     
00046       }
00047     }
00048     // If size is even, then is currently activated...
00049     if(size % 2 == 0 && time >= history[size-1] ) return true;    
00050 
00051     return false;
00052   }
00053 
00057   void PhaseHistory::activate(){
00058     activate(*current_time);
00059   }
00060 
00065   void PhaseHistory::activate(int time){
00066     // If the activation is the last thing on the history
00067     if(insertTimeInHistory(time)){
00068       last_activation_time = time;
00069       active = true;
00070     }
00071   }
00072 
00076   void PhaseHistory::deactivate(){
00077     deactivate(*current_time);
00078   }
00079 
00084   void PhaseHistory::deactivate(int time){
00085    // If the deactivation is the last thing on the history
00086     if(insertTimeInHistory(time)){
00087       last_deactivation_time = time;
00088       active = false;
00089     }
00090   }
00091 
00092 
00098   bool PhaseHistory::insertTimeInHistory(int time){
00099     // Looking for the insertion position
00100     vector<int>::iterator pos = history.end();
00101 
00102     for(vector<int>::iterator el = history.begin(); el != history.end(); el++){
00103 
00104       if( *el > time){
00105         pos = el;
00106         break;
00107       }
00108     }
00109     bool ok = false;
00110     // If it's the end of the history :-)
00111     if(pos == history.end()){
00112       ok = true;
00113     }
00114 
00115     //Inserting
00116     history.insert(pos,time);
00117     //Keeping history constrained (Or do you have unlimited memory? :-)
00118     //As erase is an expensive operation, we wait until we double the limit
00119     int hist_size = history.size();
00120     if(hist_size > 2*max_history){
00121       int keep_parity = (max_history % 2 == 1 && hist_size % 2 == 1) ? 1 : 0;
00122       history.erase(history.begin(),history.begin()+max_history+keep_parity);
00123       assert((int)history.size() % 2 == hist_size % 2); // parity kept?
00124     }
00125 
00126     return ok;
00127   }

00149   int PhaseHistory::totalActiveTime(int start){
00150     return totalActiveTime(start,*current_time);
00151   }
00152 
00158   int PhaseHistory::totalActiveTime(int start, int end){
00159     int total = 0;
00160     vector <int> intervals = getActivationsIntervals(start,end);
00161     int size = intervals.size();
00162     for(int i=1;i < size; i+=2)
00163       total += (intervals[i] - intervals[i-1]);
00164     return total;
00165   }
00166 
00167 
00173   vector <int> PhaseHistory::getActivationsIntervals(int start, int end){
00174 
00175     // Phase starts off, then first integer marks first activation
00176     int last_time = 0;
00177     vector <int> intervals;
00178     for(int i=1;i < (int)history.size(); i++){
00179       
00180       // If odd, then the history[i] value means a activation time
00181       // else you have a deactivation time, then you should count
00182       if(i%2 == 1){
00183         last_time = history[i];
00184       }else if(history[i] > start) {
00185         intervals.push_back(std::max(start,last_time)); // start of the active interval
00186         intervals.push_back(std::min(history[i],end));  // end of the active interval
00187       }
00188       
00189       // Passed trough the asked interval
00190       if(history[i] > end) break;
00191 
00192     }
00193     // If history.size is even, then Phase is currently active
00194     if(history.size() % 2 == 0 && end > last_time ){
00195       assert(active);
00196       intervals.push_back(last_time); // start of the active interval
00197       intervals.push_back(end);  // end of the active interval
00198     }
00199 
00200     return intervals;
00201   }
